issues.title: Add reference to "OAuth 2.0 Multiple Response Type Encoding Practices"
issues.author: johakoch
issues.body: As you define a new `response_mode` value, you may want to add a reference to [OAuth 2.0 Multiple Response Type Encoding Practices](https://openid.net/specs/oauth-v2-multiple-response-types-1_0.html) which defines the `response_mode` authorization request parameter.

issues.title: Use `response_mode=cookie` in example for "5.2 Unauthenticated Requests"
issues.author: johakoch
issues.body:
In section "5.2.  Unauthenticated Requests" you give an example how a protected resource may respond to an unauthenticated request by
* setting the `WWW-Authenticate` response header field with Thomas Broyer's `Cookie` auth scheme and
* setting an HTML login form as the response body content.

To me it would seem more appropriate to give an example where the response contains a redirect to the authorization endpoint using the `response_mode=cookie` that this spec defines.
